data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word بِاللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: go backwards, retreat/recede/retire, hold back/delay/postpone/defer, last/back part of a thing .Another, other, 2nd.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word وَكَانَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
data.sentence: The word وَالْيَوْمِ comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.

data.meanings: (law) - optative particle, if/though/although, conditional.Often at the start of verses/sentences.
data.sentence: The word لَوْ comes from the root ل و and is associated with the meanings: (law) - optative particle, if/though/although, conditional.Often at the start of verses/sentences.

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word عَلِيمًا comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
The word وَمَاذَا comes from the root م ا ذ ا and is associated with the meanings: What

data.meanings: to be saleable, to come out of a hole, be exhausted (store), consumed, spent, expenditure. To enter into another hole where there is another outlet, so is a hypocrite who professes to believe first one thing and then another, thus entering faith through one door and leaving it through another.nafaqan (n.acc.) hole with another outlet, tunnel.nafaqatun (n.) worthy to be spent, expenditure.nafaqu (prt. 3rd p. m. plu. III) practised hypocrisy.nafaqa (v.) to profess hypocrisy, believe in one thing and then another.munafiqun (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqin (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqat (f. plu. III) hypocrite womennifaq (v. n. III) hypocrisynifaqan (v. n. III acc.) hypocrisyanfaqa (perf. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) he had spentanfaqta (perf. 2nd p. m. sing. IV) thou hath spent.anfaqu (perf. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) they have spentanfaqtum (perf. 2nd p. m. plu. IV) Ye have spentyunfiqu (imp. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) spendstunfiquna (imp. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) Ye spendtunfiqu (imp. 2nd p. m. plu. IV acc.) Ye spendanfiqu prt. m. plu. IV) spendinfaq (v. n. ) spendingmunfiqina (m. plu.) those who spend
data.sentence: The word وَأَنْفَقُوا comes from the root ن ف ق and is associated with the meanings: to be saleable, to come out of a hole, be exhausted (store), consumed, spent, expenditure. To enter into another hole where there is another outlet, so is a hypocrite who professes to believe first one thing and then another, thus entering faith through one door and leaving it through another.nafaqan (n.acc.) hole with another outlet, tunnel.nafaqatun (n.) worthy to be spent, expenditure.nafaqu (prt. 3rd p. m. plu. III) practised hypocrisy.nafaqa (v.) to profess hypocrisy, believe in one thing and then another.munafiqun (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqin (m. plu. data.meanings: to provide, supply, bestow, grant. turzaqan - you both shall be supplied. rizq - bounty, gift. raziq - one who provides or supplies. razzaq -great provider/supplier.
data.sentence: The word رَزَقَهُمُ comes from the root ر ز ق and is associated with the meanings: to provide, supply, bestow, grant. turzaqan - you both shall be supplied. rizq - bounty, gift. raziq - one who provides or supplies. razzaq -great provider/supplier.
